critique: This document is an executive order addressing the supply of meat and poultry during the COVID-19 pandemic. It delegates authority to the Secretary of Agriculture to ensure the continued operation of meat processing facilities, consistent with CDC and OSHA guidance. It invokes the Defense Production Act to prioritize the food supply chain. There is little to suggest a strong ideological tilt. The order does not address immigration. It expands executive power by delegating authority to the Secretary of Agriculture. It could be seen as favoring federal control by overriding state actions that closed processing facilities. It balances national security (food supply) with worker safety by referencing CDC and OSHA guidance. It intervenes in the economy to ensure the supply of meat and poultry. It does not directly address social inclusion.
